channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Green or amber traffic light is not working problem, 19th December
item.description:
Permanent T/L are out of sync and not letting as many vehicles into Cheltenham as they letting vehicles out of Cheltenham. Out of Cheltenham is fine.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Multiple Street lamps out, 19th December
item.description:
Fixed by Bromford. Now not working again! Reported directly to them but they do nothing. Pitch black down alleyway. Safety issue for residents
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sage Close, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 19th December
item.description:
Pothole has come from no where is in need of looking at.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unfinshed works, 19th December
item.description:
Restricted access to my property. Works started yesterday for Openreach & has just been left leaving the smallest walkway. Due a large delivery but they will not be able to get the goods to my property. Residents were not informed that this work was being carried out & that there would be limited access.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mud on pavement. Needs gravelling, 19th December
item.description:
Footpath clean and tidy apart from one small stretch. Where they have done recent works with the stream, there has since been continuous mud that is getting worse each day. Wheelchairs/ bikes etc cant get through without getting stuck. And not fair for children walking that way to school. Needs gravelling like the rest of the path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warrener Close, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding restricting access to work, 19th December
item.description:
The Elmbridge Court Subway is flooded. This has been an increasing issue for weeks, making it hard to access work and for visitors to safely access the estate. Please can this be looked at and a long-term solution found, as this is a continuing issue. The Estate is getting busier as well, with the addition of several health practices, with the public relying on this path for access
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path/Way misused by unlawful users problem, 19th December
item.description:

Report on FixMyStreet
